info.description:
PyLithium
=========
## A framework programmed and maintained by [Jakob.](http://jakob.space/)
PyLithium is a framework for breaking toy crypto, designed for use by the CTF community.

### PyLithium is NOT designed to be used in the actual implementation of cryptographic algorithms.
Most of the primitives included in this library are laughably insecure, and there are no mitigations for vulnerabilities like side-channel attacks. If you desire reliable and well-designed cryptography, consider looking at [LibSodium](https://download.libsodium.org/doc/) instead.

PyLithium is free software, licensed under the [GNU General Public License.](http://gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html)


Supported Primitives
--------------------
* Xor
* Rotation


Installation
------------
Currently, the most reliable way to install PyLithium is through Pip.

    $ # It is recommended that you use the latest version of pip and setuptools when installing PyLithium.
    # pip install --upgrade pip setuptools
    # pip install --upgrade pylithium

Alternatively, setup.py in the repository's root directory can be used. Though this is not recommended.

    # python setup.py install

You can verify the installation from the Python REPL.

    >>> import pylithium
    >>> pylithium.__version__
    '0.1.0'


Documentation
-------------
Documentation for PyLithium is located at [pylithium.readthedocs.io](https://pylithium.readthedocs.io/), as well as in the `doc` directory.

When using PyLithium from the Python REPL, you can get immediate documentation on modules and functions with the built in `help` subroutine.

     >>> from pylithium.rot import rotate_byte
     >>> help(rotate_byte)
